stx.reactive.Streams

type
class

Static Methods

cond<T>(conditions : Iterable<stx.Tuple2<Stream<Bool>, Stream<T>>>) : Stream<T>

parameters
conditions An Iterable of Tuple2s, composed of a true/false Stream and an 'if true' Stream that will be returned if Tuple._1 == 'true.'
returns
If 'conditions' contains aTuple2._1 == 'true', Stream else a zero Stream.
Switches off of an Stream of Bools, returning the specified Stream when true

constant<I, O>(value : O, ?sources : Iterable<Stream<I>>) : Stream<O>

parameters
value The constant.
sources (Optional) Source streams.
Retrieves a constant stream. If sources are specified, events from the sources will be mapped to the constant.

create<I, O>(updater : Pulse<I> -> Propagation<O>, ?sources : Iterable<Stream<I>>) : Stream<O>

parameters
updater The updater.
sources (Optional) The sources.
Creates a new stream with the specified updater and optional sources.

identity<T>(?sources : Iterable<Stream<T>>) : Stream<T>

parameters
sources
Creates a new stream that merely propagates all pulses it receives.

merge<T>(streams : Iterable<Stream<T>>) : Stream<T>

Merges the specified streams, or returns a zero stream if there are no streams.

one<T>(val : T) : Stream<T>

Creates an event stream that will send a single value.

random(time : Int) : Stream<Float>

Creates a stream of random number events, separated by the specified number of milliseconds.

randomS(time : Signal<Int>) : Stream<Float>

Creates a stream of random number events, separated by the specified number of milliseconds.

receiver() : Stream<Unknown>

Creates a "receiver" stream whose sole purpose is to be used in combination with sendEvent().

timer(time : Int) : Stream<Int>

parameters
time The number of milliseconds.
Creates a stream of time events, spaced out by the specified number of milliseconds.

timerS(time : Signal<Int>) : Stream<Int>

parameters
time The number of milliseconds.
Creates a stream of time events, spaced out by the specified number of milliseconds.

zero<T>() : Stream<T>

Creates an event stream that will never have any events. Calling sendEvent() on such a stream will throw an exception.

zipN<T>(streams : Iterable<Stream<T>>) : Stream<Iterable<T>>

Zips together the specified streams.

Constructor

new()
